body.p: your Petitionir Leonard S. Casey says that he has, at the present August Term of the Whitly Circuit Court, been fined $75. on an Indictment for failure as a Tavern Keeper to procure and put up in his Tavern a copy of the tavern rates --

He says that he did not know that it was his duty, or he would have complied with the law. and Simply omitted, through ignorance. no real injury has resulted to the public or to any individual except to himself. He is a poor man and was very badly crippled in the Service of the Government (as a teamster) and will remain a cripple for life -- wherefore he pray your Excellcny to remit said fine
Sworn to before me by Leonard Casey this 27. augt 1864
Gov Bramlette I think the fine ought to be remitted & hope your Excellincy will remit the same

Whitley Cir Ct
